Description: Limestone ostracon: on recto and verso respectively seven and seven lines of a continuous administrative text recording a dispute over a tomb.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: S. Birch, 'Inscriptions in the Hieratic and Demotic Character, from the Collections of the British Museum' (London, 1868), pl. XIV; A. M. Blackman, 'Journal of Egyptian Archaeology' 12 (1926), pp. 176-7, pls. 34, 35, 40; S. Allam, 'Hieratische Ostraka und Papyri aus der Ramessidenzeit' (Tubingen, 1973), no. 20, pp. 43—5; K. Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions' V (Oxford 1983), pp. 475-6; D. Valbelle, 'Les Ouvriers de la Tombe', 'Revue d'Égyptologie' 96 (Cairo, 1985), pp. 287-9; A.G. McDowell, 'Village Life in Ancient Egypt' (Oxford, 1999), pp. 68-9, no. 39; R. Hari, 'Horemheb et la reine Moutnedjemet : ou, La fin d'une dynastie' (Geneva, 1964), pl. 67; 'Les artistes de Pharaon : Deir el-Médineh et la Vallée des Rois', (Paris, 2002), p. 294 [241]; G. Andreu and A. Roveri [eds.], 'Gli artisti del Faraone' (Turin, 2003), p.267 [233].
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136349) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136349)
Condition: Recto fair, verso rubbed and faded
